image.altText: A wide shot of a brick building, tin roof, with front sign reading 'Holy Spirit Church, slightly obstructed by green bushes

props.synopsis: Police charge a 38-year-old man who allegedly stabbed a Darwin priest in the face with a pen while he was setting up for evening mass.

title.children: Man charged after Darwin priest stabbed in face with pen while setting up for mass

image.altText: A man photographed  from behind, watching horse racing on pub TV screens.

props.synopsis: Three weeks after an ABC investigation raised allegations against the NT's gambling commission, the government is refusing to answer straightforward questions about what's being done – if anything.

title.children: Five questions the NT government won't answer after Four Corners investigation

image.altText: A person's hands are illuminated by the pale glow of a computer screen, as they type in a dark room.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has moved to restrict Freedom of Information request laws which, if passed, would block an environment group's long-running attempt to seek historic documents.

title.children: NT bill attempts to shield backbenchers from Freedom of Information laws

image.altText: Three people walking - men either side of one Aboriginal woman in focus. She has a soft expression, dark blue top and blazer on.

props.synopsis: Senator Namijinpa Price has denied being "hypocritical" after court hears she accused the Central Land Council of defamation ahead of the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: Senator's previous defamation claims against land council aired in court

image.altText: A little girl on the beach wearing a cap and pink top

props.synopsis: The family of a 22-month-old girl who died at a Northern Territory child care centre last year are calling on the government to ban the type of fencing that caused her death under the banner of "Ebony's Law".

title.children: Toddler's family call for 'Ebony's Law' after childcare centre death

image.altText: Four men, tanned, all have black hair, standing in dark blue uniform top and shorts, which have logo 'John Moriarty Football'

props.synopsis: Trailblazing Aboriginal soccer star and Yanyuwa man John Moriarty started a soccer program which has been driving change in remote communities across the country.

title.children: Trailblazing Aboriginal soccer star drives change in remote communities

image.altText: A dirt road leading towards a huge red rock.

props.synopsis: Crowds gather to celebrate the anniversary of a pivotal moment in the Aboriginal land rights movements, as the prime minister speaks from Uluṟu for the first time since the failed referendum.

title.children: Albanese attends Uluṟu handback anniversary in first visit since referendum

image.altText: Man smiles off to the side.

props.synopsis: Former California governor Arnold Schwarzenegger has expressed concern over the "crazy gerrymandering" that is taking place across the US.

title.children: 'Spreading like wildfire': Schwarzenegger criticises gerrymandering surge

image.altText: Bright red sunset over Brisbane

props.synopsis: More than 25,000 people are without power after south-east Queensland has been hit by storms, smoke, fires and winds.

title.children: Tens of thousands to be without power overnight in south-east Queensland

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: Loved ones of Victorian woman Hannah McGuire looked on with shock as a prosecutor told the Supreme Court of her 2024 murder and the events leading up to it.

title.children: Courtroom filled with disgust for Hannah McGuire's killer, Lachlan Young

image.altText: Firefighter sprays white substance from hose.

props.synopsis: The warning for a bushfire in northern New South Wales has been downgraded after it threatened to reach Emergency Warning level amid deteriorating weather conditions on Monday afternoon.

title.children: Firefighters halt spread of bushfire fanned by hot winds

image.altText: Donald Trump leans over and listens to Hun Manet as they sit in chairs in front of a peace sign.

props.synopsis: The US president, who is on a lightning tour of South-East Asia this week, casts a long shadow in the region. But even as he signs deals, nations are contemplating a future without him.

title.children: Trump's flashy 'peace agreement' sparks wariness in South-East Asia

image.altText: a red missile head poking out from underneath a sheet while two workers in white lab outfits work on the missile

props.synopsis: Russia says the 9M730 Burevestnik "Storm Petrel" is "invincible" to current and future missile defences, with an almost unlimited range and unpredictable flight path.

title.children: Putin says Russia has a new missile 'nobody else in the world has'

image.altText: Man and policeman

props.synopsis: The family of a 43-year-old one-punch attack victim told his killer their lives "have been shattered beyond recognition" during an emotional Queensland court hearing.

title.children: One-punch killer Joshua Berrigan sentenced to 10 years' jail

image.altText: A man wearing a dark shirt stands outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Photos and videos shown to a Victorian court capture a racially charged speech given by Thomas Sewell before he leads a group of 30 masked men through Ballarat.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell claims Ballarat rally was political

image.altText: A colourful display of contraceptive devices.

props.synopsis: Including the NuvaRing on the PBS will slash the cost of contraception for tens of thousands of Australians by around two-thirds.

title.children: This contraceptive is going on the PBS. Here's how that may impact you

image.altText: F1 driver sitting on a stool in the pit lane after winning and F1 race

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has lost his lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship. Despite momentum working against the Australian, there are still plenty of reasons to believe he can win the world title.

title.children: Piastri's lead is gone, but there is hope in his bid for the F1 title

image.altText: peg stands against brick wall holding her phone

props.synopsis: Data from the latest HILDA survey indicate socialising rates have dropped over the past two decades, and, more recently, have not returned to pre-COVID frequency.

title.children: We are socialising less and loneliness is rising. Here is what can help

image.altText: Close-up of the Kirpan hanging above jean pockets

props.synopsis: Concertgoers who had tickets to see an Indian music superstar have been offered a refund after refusing to leave their Sikh dagger at the gate.

title.children: Fans miss Indian megastar's Sydney concert over religious dagger ban

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese's face.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese sat down with Premier Li Qiang — China's second most senior leader — on the sidelines of the ASEAN meeting in Kuala Lumpur on Monday morning.

title.children: Albanese raised 'unsafe' military encounter in talks with Chinese premier

image.altText: a close up of the microsoft logo, a window coloured red, green, blue, yellow

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog is suing Microsoft for allegedly misleading about 2.7 million Australians over its Microsoft 365 subscriptions.

title.children: ACCC alleges Microsoft 'deliberately hid' cheaper Microsoft 365 subscription

image.altText: A man in a cap looks a the camera

props.synopsis: As juveniles in Kununurra continue to be arrested over car thefts, community leaders and the government are looking for solutions

title.children: Kununurra leaders say night space key to solving youth crime

image.altText: Fuel pump covered in plastic at a gas station, four dogs sit on the forecourt.

props.synopsis: US forecasters believe the Category 4 hurricane could reach Category 5 status, unleashing torrential rain and threatening to cause catastrophic flooding in the northern Caribbean, including Haiti and Jamaica.

title.children: Hurricane Melissa strengthens as it approaches Jamaica

image.altText: Two players in cricket whites walk off the field smiling and laughing and holding their bats

props.synopsis: With Cam Green and Steve Smith shaping as the mostly likely candidates to be selected as Australia's No.3 for this summer's Ashes, selectors face a choice between pragmatism and tradition.

title.children: Why Cam Green staying at No.3 could help get the best out of Steve Smith

image.altText: A basket lift outside the Louvre museum.

props.synopsis: What do we know about the investigation into the jewel heist at the Louvre and what are some of the possible consequences?

title.children: Could the theft of gold and jewels from the Louvre have a silver lining?

image.altText: Loaves of bread in bakery

props.synopsis: A fire at an industrial bread facility in Perth's south causes a shortage of sliced bread on supermarket shelves across Western Australia.

title.children: Perth commercial bakery fire sparks sliced bread shortage

image.altText: An F/A-18F Super Hornet aircraft landing on a us navy carrier ship

props.synopsis: Both aircraft went down while conducting "routine operations", the US Navy said, adding that five personnel were "safe and in stable condition" after the crashes.

title.children: Two US Navy aircraft crash within 30 minutes in South China Sea

image.altText: Holly Rankin in a suit and sitting in a chair smiles, stainless steel pitcher next to her on a table, wood paneled wall.

props.synopsis: Labor has ruled out changing copyright laws to give tech giants free rein to train artificial intelligence models on creative works after the proposition was met with widespread backlash from artists.

title.children: Artists tell AI to 'solve the problem' as copyright carve-out ruled out

image.altText: A man cheers with his arms in the air.

props.synopsis: Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei has won decisive victories in the midterm elections, in an election where Donald Trump loomed large.

title.children: Argentina's Javier Milei wins in decisive midterms as Trump looms large

image.altText: Big red ship docked in water

props.synopsis: The head of Tasmania's state-owned ferry operator blames "human error" for a berth problem that needs a $9 million fix and modification to the hulls of the two new Spirit of Tasmania ships.

title.children: 'Clearly human error': TT-Line sent wrong specs, leading to $9m Spirit ferry fix

image.altText: California Governor Gavin Newsom speaks at a press conference in Los Angeles.

props.synopsis: The California Governor says he will make a decision after the 2026 midterm elections.

title.children: Gavin Newsom to consider US presidential run

image.altText: A middle-aged woman, smiling

props.synopsis: The 68-year-old former barrister is known for being one of the leading pro-Palestinian voices in the Irish parliament.

title.children: Who is Catherine Connolly, Ireland's new left-leaning, independent president-elect?

image.altText: Person in a winter jacket looking at the flight board in the airport

props.synopsis: Readers share their challenges in getting flights refunded when booking through a third-party travel agent. We asked experts what that process should look like, what your rights are, and where to get additional support.

title.children: How to get a refund from your travel agent if flights cancelled or delayed
